column4: my usb mouse breaks after sometime unless I reboot before it works again, please what might be the cause
my machine specs are Toshiba Satellite M70
please read the comment from the channel bot
it can be all sorts of things - bad mouse bad motherboard, the usb infrastructure can fall apart at times try the mouse in a different port it might help
usb is not some kind of magic but it can feel like it sometimes
my mouse is very new bought a couples of days ago
means nothing really, now have you used other ports already?
try a different mouse - if it works then it is the mouse?
it does the same with every mouse I use, couldn't it be a video card driver issue?
you suspect a video card that is a bit random is it not?
is there a way to get running again with I have to reboot?
does your on machine mouse work?
yep that works even if the usb mouse breaks
I suggest you consult this web page, help.ubuntu.com/community/BootOptions and try some of the options, can you use a proper ps2 connection on the laptop?
vis the ps2 if you can it is usually the best way to deal with mice issues
